creator: szymon@efigence.com
text:
Let's map the Webdav Servlet to url-patern="/files/*". While accessing
/context/files/ from a web browser (request served by methods of DefaultServlet
- I guess) the result is a content of context's root directory. However while
accessing the same location from a webdav client (eg MSIE 5.5 or 6.0) the result
is a content of /files/ directory from a context's root.
Of course it is impossible to access any file from them because of a GET request
that will be served by a DefalutServlet's methods that will look for the
requested file in '/' instead of 'files/'

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
Mapping the webdav servlet as anything but a replacement for the default 
servlet ('/' mapping) is not supported. If you want to fix, please go ahead and 
submit a patch.

creator: remm@apache.org
text: This won't be fixed in 4.1.x (the WebDAV servlet must be mapped as '/').
